unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Finding the Standard Deviation of $X-Y$
question_text:
A random variable $X$ has a mean of $40$ and standard deviation of $7$. A random variable $Y$ has a mean of $30$ and a standard deviation of $5$.
If $X$ and $Y$ are independent, approximately what is the standard deviation of $X-Y$?
